summary: This document is a Know Your Customer (KYC) report for Jeffrey Epstein and his associated accounts at Deutsche Bank. It details the relationships, account ownership, and financial activities related to Epstein, including his connections to Darren Indyke and Zorro Development Corp. The report highlights the purpose of the accounts and the expected inflows and outflows.

persons.name: Jeffrey Epstein
persons.context: Jeffrey Epstein is identified as a current client of Deutsche Bank, seeking to open new accounts for his financial activities.

persons.name: Paul Morris
persons.context: Paul Morris is the relationship manager for Jeffrey Epstein at Deutsche Bank, having previously worked with him at JP Morgan.

persons.name: Darren Indyke
persons.context: Darren Indyke is mentioned as a primary contact for the accounts associated with Jeffrey Epstein.

connections.description: Paul Morris is the relationship manager for Jeffrey Epstein at Deutsche Bank, having previously managed him at JP Morgan.
Darren Indyke is identified as a lawyer and primary contact for Jeffrey Epstein's accounts.
Jeffrey Epstein is the sole owner of Zorro Development Corp., which is involved in managing his financial activities.

locations: 6100 Red Hook Quarter, B3 St. Thomas 00802 USVI
keyFacts: Jeffrey Epstein is a client of Deutsche Bank and is seeking to open new accounts.
Paul Morris is the relationship manager for Epstein, having previously worked with him at JP Morgan.
Darren Indyke is identified as Epstein's lawyer and primary contact for his accounts.
Zorro Development Corp. is owned entirely by Jeffrey Epstein and is used for managing his financial activities.
The accounts are expected to have inflows and outflows ranging from $1,000 to $10,000 monthly.
